Unit runs ok for me. 
Be careful this would be incompatible for existing deployment if one already deployed. The one who already load the format of old version, will need
a. Drop the old metadata that have the concept of datasource
b. Recreate the metadata (for hadoop cases, re-run the sh files to create them)

Kindly do not approve this pull request. I just need this to make release build work

This pr may conflict with the entity model, as I have recovered the AlertAPIEntity. alertContext.properties remain here. 

You can check the newest code
Could you please paste the previous and current sample alert json content here?

It's not a good practice to send the two pull requests (for both EAGLE-287 and EAGLE-289) in the same pull request

For pull request #170, I don't think it's a good fix (the code needs testing)

Here is my fix in the dev branch, and tested it.

merged into dev branch
Close the pull request.

CLosing this pull request, to commit : 
EAGLE-291 : JDBC: Update transactions fail in PostgreSQL

Basically, adding a notification plugin is a issue related to policy definition, but not to a specific topology.

I have another idea to handle this issue, but not adding a configuration value for a specific topology. 
That is, let the front end provide a default notification plugin EagleStore when define a policy.  

How do you think?

That's really a big pull request!

I don't have too much background on this new feature, and just check the code that i am familiar with. :-)

In HDFSCommandResolver.java, the command set have been changed. Do you have thorough tests on this topology after changing this resolver?

Because i have a concern. As the command set are from the hdfs audit log, but not original hdfs commands (resembler has not been completed yet). If you change the command set here, they may mismatch the parsed value from the log

Please rename `eagle-core/eagle-data-process/eagle-stream-process-api/src/main/Resource` into `eagle-core/eagle-data-process/eagle-stream-process-api/src/main/resources` (where is `resources` instead of `Resource`)
Done. Please review.
please review

Thanks for the contribution 👍 , but as more common practice, it's better to use `0.4.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT` instead of `0.4.0-SNAPSHOT-incubating` where `0.4.0-incubating` is the target version and postfix "-SNAPSHOT" stands for temporary status which maybe removed after released :-)

OK. Will change it right now.

> stands for temporary status which maybe removed after released :-)
